shortdesc.p: American Vernacular English (AAEV) has its roots in the enslavement of Africans by colonists. AAEV is an inner circle English (Kachru). Two hypotheses are debated, AAEV has its roots with English colonists ('Anglicist Hypotheses'), or AAEV has its roots with a creole ('Creolist Hypotheses'). Opinions differ based on racial grounds (black vs. white).
